summary: Email chain between defense attorney Bruce Barket and an MCC official regarding a leak of information about Nicholas Tartaglione's possible involvement in an attack on Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. Barket requests the leak be included in an investigation, while the official states it is an open investigation and denies sharing information.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione, complaining about a leak of false information regarding his client's possible involvement in an attack on Jeffrey Epstein at MCC.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Bruce Barket's client, an inmate at MCC who was reportedly questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate at MCC who was the subject of a possible attack, which led to questioning of Nicholas Tartaglione.

persons.name: Tracy Connor
persons.context: Journalist from The Daily Beast who contacted Bruce Barket seeking comment for a story about Tartaglione being questioned regarding Epstein.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the defense attorney representing inmate Nicholas Tartaglione.
Both were inmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), with Tartaglione questioned about a possible attack on Epstein.
Journalist Tracy Connor contacted attorney Bruce Barket for comment on a story regarding his client and Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Media Inquiry About Epstein Attack
events.description: Tracy Connor, an executive editor, emails Bruce Barket seeking comment for a story about his client Nicholas Tartaglione being questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at MCC.

events.title: Attorney Complaint About Information Leak
events.description: Bruce Barket emails an MCC official complaining about a leak of false information regarding his client Nicholas Tartaglione's possible involvement in an attack on Jeffrey Epstein, requesting the leak be included in an investigation.

locations: 666 Old Country Road, Ste. 700, Garden City, NY 11530
keyFacts: Attorney Bruce Barket alleged a leak of false information from the MCC regarding his client Nicholas Tartaglione's possible involvement in an attack on Jeffrey Epstein.
An MCC official stated the matter was under an open investigation and denied that staff had shared information with the press or public.
Journalist Tracy Connor from The Daily Beast contacted Barket on July 24, 2019, for comment on a story about Tartaglione being questioned regarding Epstein.
The email chain indicates concerns about inmate safety and potential retaliation following complaints made to the court.
